thread.title: Berlin braced for U.S. steel, aluminum tariffs from June 1

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Berlin braced for U.S. steel, aluminum tariffs from June 1
text:
BERLIN, May 30 (Reuters) - U.S. steel and aluminium tariffs will probably take effect on June 1 unless a deal is struck, a spokesman for the German economy ministry said on Wednesday.
U.S. President Donald Trump has granted the European Union an exemption from the tariffs until June 1.
Asked about the procedure, the ministry spokesman said:
“As far as I know it is in the night (going into) June 1,” said the spokesman. “As far as I know, they (the tariffs) would automatically take effect,” he said, adding talks were still going on to try to get a deal. (Reporting by Michelle Martin and Madeline Chambers)
